intro: Dichelostemma capitatum subsp. lacuna-vernalis, commonly known as the spring bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a cluster of flowers at the top of a sturdy stem. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting local pollinators.
